intro: Tetranthera ferruginea, commonly known as the rusty tetranthera, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants such as buckwheat and sorrel. The plant is characterized by its upright, branched stems and small, clustered flowers that are typically greenish-white in color. Its leaves are alternate, ovate to elliptic in shape, and often have a reddish or rusty tint on the underside. Tetranthera ferruginea is typically found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories.
